# Projects and Publications
The following projects and publications are examples of CASFRI in action!

<!--html_preserve-->
<div class="band full">
  <div class="bandContent projectSection">
    <div class="projectSectionTitle">Projects</div>
    <div class="projectIntro">CASFRI has been used in a range of projects requiring continuous coverage of forest attributes.</div>
    <div class="projectItems">
      
      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://borealbirds.ualberta.ca/"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_bam.png"/></a>
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://borealbirds.ualberta.ca/" class="projectItemLabel">The Boreal Avian Modelling Project</a>
        <div class="projectItemDescription">The BAM project has used CASFRI to model bird density and habitat associations using continuous coverages of forest attributes across the Canadian boreal.</div>
      </div>
      
      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://nfi.nfis.org/en/"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_nfi.png"/></a>
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://nfi.nfis.org/en/" class="projectItemLabel">Canada's National Forest Inventory</a>
        <div class="projectItemDescription">The NFI has applied the CASFRI framework to develop an ongoing historical database of Canada's forests.</div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="bandContent projectSection">
    <div class="projectSectionTitle">Publications</div>
    <div class="projectIntro">The following is a list of publications using CASFRI.</div>
    <div class="projectItems">
      
      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="http://www.cef.ulaval.ca/uploads/Membres/CAS_Backgrounder_v1.0.pdf"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_backgrounder.png"/></a>
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="http://www.cef.ulaval.ca/uploads/Membres/CAS_Backgrounder_v1.0.pdf" class="projectItemLabel">CASFRI backgrounder document</a>

      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://cdnsciencepub.com/doi/abs/10.1139/cjfr-2014-0102"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_cumming2014.png"/></a>

      <div class="projectItem">

      <div class="projectItem">

      </div>
      
      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://cbmjournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13021-016-0065-6"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_Boisvenue2016_a.png"/></a>
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://cbmjournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13021-016-0065-6" class="projectItemLabel">Boisvenue et al. 2016</a>

      </div>
      
      <div class="projectItem">
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S037811271630319X"><img class="projectItemImage" src="images/project_Boisvenue2016_b.png"/></a>
        <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S037811271630319X" class="projectItemLabel">Boisvenue et al. 2016</a>

<br>

* Estimating the Historical Range of Variation in forest songbird abundances within managed forests of Alberta, Ontario and Quebec. PhD thesis project. Ana Raymundo Sanchez, supervised by Cumming.

* Downscaling national models of songbird density to inform forest management planning. PhD thesis project. Isolde Lane-Shaw, supervised by Cumming.

* Evaluating two data sources to initialize vegetation state of forest dynamics models: 1) the Forest Inventory non-parametric K-nearest neighbors procedure (kNN), and 2)  the Common Attribute schema for Forest Resource Inventory Data (Raymundo-Sanchez, Lane-Shaw, Cumming and others).

* Changes in age structure and tree-species composition of managed boreal forests in western Canada: 1990-2020. A new collaboration between the Cumming lab and CWS.
